subject: Sales
title: The Silk Road: Long-Distance Selling
description: A 60-second lesson on The Silk Road: Long-Distance Selling.

hook.text: Silk traveled four thousand miles from China to Rome. Its price multiplied a thousandfold along the way.

buildup.text: The Silk Road was history's first global supply chain: merchants, middlemen, and markups across continents.

discovery.text: Traders didn't just transport goods. They carried origin stories that made exotic products irresistible.

twist.text: Most merchants never traveled the full route. Goods passed through dozens of hands and price markups.

climax.text: The Silk Road proved that distance creates perceived value. Rarity plus story equals premium pricing.

punchline.text: Distance, rarity, and a good story create value.

quiz.question: How did the Silk Road increase product value?
options: Distance and origin stories created perceived rarity and value
